Jeff Schmidt, Disciplined Minds: A Critical Look at Salaried Professionals and the Soul-Battering System that Shapes their Lives, p.15

"For understanding the professional, the concept of 'ideology' will emerge as much more useful than that of 'skill'. But what is ideology, exactly? Ideology is thought that justifies action, including routine day-to-day activity ... your ideology justifies your own actions to yourself. Economics may bring you back to your employer day after day, but it is ideology that makes that activity feel like a reasonable or unreasonable way to spend your life."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Definition of Ideology
